text: Hi. I am using HubSpot APIs on the local react app with the private app access token. There, I am getting CORS errors like this. How can I solve this?
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/CORS-issue/m-p/306388/highlight/true#M29031>
Hi guys, Is it possible to fetch an specific object using a property different than the ID?
yep if the property is a unique property you can use the idProperty parameter
I dont have unique properties and can’t convert an exisiting property to unique
so your only option is to use the search endpoint to do that search
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search#filter-search-results>
In that above example you just need to swap firstname with the name of your property

Hi there, truly hoping someone can help. We currently use V3 of the API, and want to set specific companies as the 'primary' association label of all contacts. Is this possible to do on V3? I've been told by HubSpot that it's available on V4, however I don't know what are (if any) the implications of moving everything to V4, or whether they could run alongside each other?
they can run alongside each other
also the v4 endpoints are pretty much all backwards compatible with the v3 endpoints. couple of things that are different is the schemas and associations endpoint
<@U01QVR44MEY> is their a way to get object schemas of default objects as well?
yes, you just have to hit the endpoint
so like `/crm/v3/schemas/contacts`

Thank you for the response. Now I am trying to call the API through a proxy from my backend application. And I am using the private app's access token to call that API. Now it's giving a forbidden error. Can anyone give a solution?

Hey all! Trying to figure out the best way to retrieve all properties from 60k tickets, without loading up our daily API calls! What is the best way to do this in bulk so we don't max out our daily allowance of calls. Seems very inefficient, but I'm pretty new to this API and maybe I'm missing something. I'm trying to use either Ruby or Python for this API.
you could use the export tool
That's really the best way
and if you're trying to do a sync with another tool/database I would suggest doing an export first and then connecting the sync so you only have to sync changes after that point
which would cut down on the api calls by a exponential amount

Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>, 1 time export then syncing sounds perfect, although I'm not sure how I would query only the changes? Seems like there's barely any documentation on this functionality for Python :confused:
You could use webhooks
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks>
PSA: DON"T USE THE PYTHON SDK, I would use the direct endpoints, the SDK just isn't really well maintained and you'll get up spending a lot of time trying to do simple things
Haha exactly why I'm here I guess! I'll shift over to webhooks!! Really appreciate the quick responses! This was more helpful than a days worth of browsing the docs trying to find Python resources.
yes of course, hit me up if you run into any issues
Will do, thanks!

If I already have an api secondary domain established in my HubSpot account and my developer wants to attach another IP address to it for website page calls, is that possible or do I need to create a new domain?
is there also an API that returns list of Objects?
not really, there's around 130 objects total
do you want all of them?
or do you just want the common ones like contacts, companies, tickets, deals
common ones
ok then just use the names above with the above api

Hi, Need some help to fetch deals with association data using DEAL-ID. I have tested this API in post man <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/:dealID>. It was working fine. But it displaying only deals data without associations. Can anyone please let me know what was the issue.
what types of associations do you want?
adding `&associations=contacts,companies`  will pull in the contact and company associations
to the url

Hey <@U01QVR44MEY> - I think i was reading what you said wrong - you meant for me to manually use the export tool in HubSpot, then set up webhooks for any time a ticket is updated to push the update in to my side database for an update? I'm actually not sure if this works for us. What would be ideal is if we could just use an API to pull the export (we have a view set up) daily... We have more downstream automations that happen with the XLSX from the view. Don't have a side database set up for this.

Hey <@U04SSFH4VJ6> — maybe consider the product we built → <https://sequin.io|Sequin>

We’ll sync all your tickets to your database in real-time. Then, when all the data is in a DB, you can easily automate this workflow into Excel. I’d be happy to show you how it works if you have some time today.
Are you passing the private app access token as an Authorization header with Bearer app_token
yes
Are you able to paste the code you are using to call the API (excluding the private app token)
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts?limit=100> this one
What is the full error you are receiving ?

Hello,

I am in the process of updating from the v1 API to v3 (late to the party, I know).

My organization uses the API to keep our Tableau reports up to date in as close to real time as possible, so we only want to see the records that have been updated recently.

For CRM objects I am accomplishing this by querying the SEARCH api filtered by hs_lastmodifieddate then sending each page of 100 ids to the BATCH READ endpoint.

My problem is with associations. I don't see any way to retrieve associations in batches. Retrieving them one id at a time will require too many api calls, and retrieving the entire list of objects with associations is too much data for the job that runs every 10 - 15 minutes to handle.

I am just hoping someone here can point out something I've missed. Thanks in advance!

Error: Request failed with status code 403
    at createError (createError.js:16:1)
    at settle (settle.js:18:1)
    at XMLHttpRequest.handleLoad (xhr.js:59:1)
did you check this box when you created your private app token?
Are you trying to pull in associations for multiple object pairs? or all associations per object?
Yes
give that a whirl

All associations for all Engagements objects that were recently added or updated. So if, for example, I search for all Calls in the last 24 hours and get 100 records back, I would like to be able to get all associations along with the other properties for those calls.
oops that looks silly
Hey there.. I'm trying to get the HubSpot "search contact" API call to work, but I keep getting a "405 - Method Not Allowed".. Any ideas??
Are you using POST?
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1678155677282779>
yes.. with postman ..
I've tested multiple payloads from multiple examples..
last one i tried
Can you send over a postman screenshot?
which window?
body?
really the only reason for that error is that you're either endpoint or the wrong method
:object_type replace with contact
or 0-1
:object_type = "contacts"
one sec
you also need a , after } just before "limit"
one sec
there's a better JSON payload
still same
result
Fixed the previous one also...
do you want to just try this url? <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/search>
paste it in directly
just ran a test on my end and everything was fine
you're not using the url I just sent you...
v3 vs v4
correct... v4 should work also.. i'm pulling from v4 docs ..
ugh
one sec
here's the search docs: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
I've poured over these .. obviously they've broken it in v4 ..
there was no v4 search endpoint
what are you referring to? Did you see it somewhere?
yes ... there are v4 endpoints..
one sec
no v4 search endpoint
how silly!!  list, create, delete in v4 ... nothing else ... that's gonna mess a lot of people up ..
associations is also in v4
search is very much a separate applications, different rate limits even so makes sense that it would be a different endpoint
there are quite a few in v4, but not all .. most api's stretch all calls over the version.. notjust "some" of them..
as long as you're following the docs you should have no issues
the versioning is the weirdness here..
the docs tell you which version to use
not saying you're wrong
Yeah, with HubSpot, i'll not assume the v4 is "enabled" or "released"
ok
thanks for the help !
of course

Hi All (from down under),
Have any of the developers in here solved the issue with the Lead Webhook. In particular the webhook for Lead Status changes and Notes changes/updates. We noticed these community forums but they are over 5 years old so I am hoping this has been resolved.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Contact-Updated-webhook-for-any-property/m-p/241391>
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Register-Webhook-for-Notes-creation/m-p/241376#M20272>
<@U037QED9TR6> have you had any success :arrow_up:
No idea on notes but you can set up a webhook for hs_lead_status on either contact or company records <@U04KWLKKYQY>
Jacob, thank you. We will test that out. Much appreciated. I am assuming that is the Operations Hub or Enterprise that needs to be active to create the webhook?
I just set it up in a developer account under the an app -> webhooks
OK great... thank you.
I’m sure you can probably do something similar with operations hub, but I haven’t used it before.
you have to install the app on the HubSpot account you want to track though, and you also need to request one oauth token for the app to be installed

it works on first and lastname

your request will look like this
this will pull in any firstnames that start with scot

so:
`scot`
`scott`
`scotty`

pulls anything with "whi" as the firtname

I agree with Scott, I feel the API versioning is a bit mess.
In the doc, there is some Contact/Company Apis are saying v3 but v4 also works. So I changed all my API to using v4 until I work with Search contacts
that would do an exact search
you can use a wildcard character to pull in like values
for example: `5E2C0*`
using operator CONTAINS_TOKEN?
yep
let me check
yeah, messy ..
well the search api is a little different then the other apis (different system, different rate limit) but at some point in the future it will operate on the v4 endpoint
definitely not the preferred setup but it is how it is
like these?
That will pull in property values that contain 5E2C0239 exactly

but it will also pull in things like:
```5E2C02392932
1235E2C0239```
the * char like % in SQL Server?
yes
basically

I’m total fine with how the Apis work. I just said the Api doc is a bit messy. I would prefer to have a dropdown with each endpoint which version they are supporting. With that information will prevent those kind of questions
Not all endpoints are compatible across different versions though
it works! Thanks!!
that's why each endpoint has a separate doc for the different versions
of course

I think what we're saying <@U01QVR44MEY> is that MOST API's are compatible across the versions ...  if there's an endpoint for v3, there's one for v4 also to match ... v4 isn't "missing" on most API platforms ... they coincide with v4 having additional features.. (most backward compatible with EOL phaseout)
Thanks. I can able to fetch the company details now.
